Angular Dark Mode Element Checklist | Generated by AI

Home 2025.10

When you implement a dark mode in an Angular frontend, you‚Äôll usually start with body, select, and option, but there are quite a few other common HTML elements you‚Äôll want to restyle so the theme feels consistent. Here‚Äôs a practical checklist:

Page-Level and Containers

  • html, body ‚Üí background and text color.
  • div, section, article, aside, header, footer, main, nav ‚Üí set background and text colors (especially if they have default white backgrounds).

Text and Headings

  • h1, h2, h3, h4, h5, h6 ‚Üí make sure text is visible against dark background.
  • p, span, a ‚Üí adjust text color, link hover colors, and visited link states.

Forms and Inputs

  • input[type="text"], input[type="password"], input[type="email"], textarea ‚Üí background, text color, and border.
  • input[type="checkbox"], input[type="radio"] ‚Üí sometimes need special handling for visibility.
  • select, option ‚Üí as you mentioned, both background and text color.
  • button ‚Üí background, border, and text color, plus hover/active states.
  • label ‚Üí ensure text contrasts with dark background.
  • fieldset, legend ‚Üí background and border.

Lists and Tables

  • ul, ol, li ‚Üí text color.
  • table ‚Üí background, border color, and text color.
  • thead, tbody, tr, th, td ‚Üí individual adjustments for backgrounds and borders.

Interactive Elements

  • details, summary ‚Üí background and text.
  • dialog ‚Üí background and text.
  • mark ‚Üí highlight colors should work on dark (default yellow may be too bright).

Media and Misc

  • hr ‚Üí border color (default is often too light on dark).
  • code, pre ‚Üí background and text color for readability.
  • blockquote ‚Üí background and border color.
  • progress, meter ‚Üí track and value colors.

üí° Best practice: Instead of using !important everywhere, define CSS variables for colors (--bg-color, --text-color, etc.) and swap them when dark mode is active (e.g., add a .dark-mode class to body). That way, Angular components and custom elements can also hook into the theme cleanly.
